alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 31 at 6:25PM PST until January 01 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet will continue through early Monday morning. Local breakers up to 10 feet will be possible near Point Conception. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...Until 10 AM Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of elevated surf and dangerous rip currents will likely return Wednesday into Thursday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
